Package com.example.noram.controller

Class EventManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.noram.controller.EventManager
public class EventManager extends Object
A class to provide services when interacting with events in the app, such as signing-in events.
Author:
Gabriel, Carlin, Ethan

    • displayAttendeeEvent

      public static void displayAttendeeEvent(android.content.Context context, Event event)
      An event's information is displayed on the attendee side, showing all the attendee-event info
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the activity calling this function, from where the new activity is started
      event - The event whose information need to be displayed

    • displayOrganizerEvent

      public static void displayOrganizerEvent(android.content.Context context, Event event)
      An event's information is displayed on the organizer side, showing all the organizer-event info
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the activity calling this function, from where the new activity is started
      event - The event whose information need to be displayed

    • displayOrganizerEvent

      public static void displayOrganizerEvent(android.content.Context context, Event event, boolean reset)
      Overloads displayOrganizerEvent() with extra 'reset' parameter to optionally let the user clear the current activity stack when launching a new activity launching the new activity
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the activity calling this function, from where the new activity is started
      event - The event whose information need to be displayed
      reset - If true, all the activities on the stack are removed when the new activity is launched

    • displayCheckedInEvent

      public static void displayCheckedInEvent(android.content.Context context, Event event)
      An event's information is displayed by calling a new activity with all of its information. Additional information is passed so that CheckedIn display is guaranteed to be displayed (in case of database latency)
      Parameters:
      context - The context of the activity calling this function, from where the new activity is started
      event - The event whose information need to be displayed
